column1: "i had an 8 hour shift tonight and i feel like they really needed me but i just couldn't do it. <e1>i feel really judged</e1> on some level whenever i go in because <e2>i'm socially kind of weird</e2> which honestly is a new development and <e3>it makes me wonder if i've just always been strange and didn't notice which i feel worse about</e3>. <e4>i've also gotten pretty good at my job and they've started to depend on me a bit</e4>, but <e5>i feel so nauseous and anxious</e5> that <e6>i just don't have the confidence that i could go through the day without ruining the morale or just fucking it up in general</e6>. i'm thinking about going back to my therapist and getting back on prozac or something, fuck me"

"how to be happy or at least less sad it's not your typical self help book so it can be good for those who aren't into those.  it's got creative and interactive aspects-good for keeping your mind busy if you're anxious.look at the first few pages on amazon-i think it could be a game changer for some.edit: do it in pencil perhaps so you can maybe erase and use it again down the road.  i find when i have outbreaks of depression/or anxiety i re-visit my books but they are marked in from times past, sometimes im going through something different now and it gets confusing to add in new info"

"i am half a year into my new role after a promotion where i am one step above my coworkers as a team lead. <e1>i am a yes person and as always</e1>, this role <e2>feels unbearable, overwhelming</e2>, and different than it was before the person before me left. it all comes down to me being unable to say no. <e3>i fear that in 5 years ill have created a terrible role all</e3> because <e4>i didnt set boundaries</e4>. my teammates rely on me so much more than they did the person before.  now <e5>i am full of guilt and anxiety</e5> because <e6>i feel like im being taken advantage of</e6>, and <e7>doing work that really should be done by a manager</e7>. all because i let it happen.i want to quit already and have a job with no responsibility. how do i communicate this to my boss (my boss is different than the manager), without sounding like i am against working hard? this is not the case, i just dont like feeling like im being taken advantage of and doing things outside of my pay scale."

"so i started streaming recently with the goal being to create a place for anyone who is depressed, anxious or struggling with anything to hang out and have someone to talk to. please come join if you ever feel lonely or need to hear someones voice."

"i cant sleep cause <e1>im anxious</e1> about <e2>having to wake up and go to work</e2>. i hate work. <e3>work</e3> makes me <e4>sad and angry</e4>. i just wanna stay in bed and sleep. i love sleep once i fall asleep but i have having to go to sleep. <e5>my wife snoring next to me</e5> doesnt help either. she falls asleep so easily. i just <e6>cant stop stressing</e6> over 8 hours of work. its so long. idk what kind of day is in store for me. how annoyed and angry will infer? how hard will it be to put on a cheerful tone and act like i give a fuck?once i get home im good, but <e7>it feels like i blink and its already time for sleep and work again</e7>. fuck. i just cant.the meds dont seem to help. <e8>i feel more anxious</e8> now than before. the anxiety is really debilitating.anyway i just needed to vent."

"that dull, robotic, empty feeling you get where you just ""exist"" and have zero motivation to do even the slightest thing and anything you do manage to do has to be done on ""auto-pilot"". it's as if someone removed your brain and you just walk around in zombie mode all day. no feeling, joy, interest or anything else for that matter.ever feel like that?."

"-wipe the crumbs off of your bed -open the window -clear off your nightstand of things that dont belong -drink an energy shake (absolute life savers) -if you dont have them, at least put energy shakes on your grocery list -if you dont have a grocery list, make one -reply to at least one text, preferably the one from your mom or your best friend -brush your teeth or at least try to use some mouth wash -change your clothes if you know you wont make it to the shower today -make a to do list for things youre worrying about, then put it in a different room, like your kitchen, so you can think about it when youre readyplease add anything youve found to be helpful or that you were proud you were able to do, no matter how small.edit: i meant protein shakes. energy drinks arent always the best option for anxious bodies lol"

"i struggle with anxiety and depression that includes extensive insomnia. <e1>i called out of work today</e1> because <e2>i couldnt sleep at all</e2>. <e3>I had mild panic attacks laying in bed on and off for hours</e3>. now, <e4>im still anxious and depressed</e4>, but <e5>i also feel extremely guilty</e5> for <e6>calling out of work</e6>. I am scared i wont sleep again tonight, and <e7>im just getting overwhelmed</e7>. <e8>i posted this</e8> to air my feelings, but is there anyone who experiences something similar?"

"<e1>i was having a hard time</e1> this morning so <e2>i decided to watch some videos</e2> that would make me laugh. they did make me laugh at first but, <e3>as i scrolled further down, all i saw were videos of hatred and destruction</e3>. <e4>i can't deal with this</e4>. i hate the world we live in. it's just a shithole that everyone is hoping will just fix itself. it's to the point where <e5>my anxiety is triggered</e5> by just <e6>thinking about having to leave the house</e6> because <e7>i'm afraid of everything</e7>. everything is dangerous. and everyone is out to get me. fuck... i really don't wanna do this anymore..."

no one is messaging / replying to me. games are boring. tv boring. want to sleep but won't. just fed up with everything. overwhelmed with the news. no passion. alone. no one loves me. no one will. i'm a failure.

"my <e1>anxiety</e1> takes the form of <e2>constantly fixating on my mistakes</e2>, which are small in the grand scheme of things, and <e3>not being able to get over thinking that i am a terrible person</e3>. theyre things that i would excuse in my friends and other people, but since ive done them theyre unforgivable. <e4>i also struggle a lot</e4> with <e5>jealousy about people who dont care when they are intentionally mean or hurtful (like i wish i could have that blas attitude), even though i dont really want to be like that</e5>.my therapist describes it like scales: <e6>any good i do will never outweigh the ways i see myself as having fucked up in certain situations</e6>. this <e7>anxiety</e7> leads me to <e8>have bad bouts of depression</e8> where im unable to kick it, and <e9>i always feel like i am the worst person in the world</e9>. i cant get my brain to be quiet and its just always telling me how terrible i am.anyone else feel this way - and if so, how have you dealt with it?"

"hi all, i am new to reddit. i recently made an account, have been lurking for years though. i went to the doctor and found a psychologist but they cannot schedule me until next month when they offically start at the office i booked with. this office is free and near me. one of the only free ones. i have probably two months until i can start seeing someone to help wuth my issues. i wont go into too much detail about them in this post, but <e1>i am over thinking a lot</e1> and <e2>feel like i am insane</e2>. <e3>i dont know how to cope and am crying and breaking down every night almost</e3>. any advice? thanks"

"<e1>i had kicked my depression and had my anxiety under control for a while. now that it's nearly February it's back and it's bad</e1>. <e2>i feel like a hole is swallowing me up. i feel ugly and scared all the time. i feel useless and ashamed of myself. i drag myself to work and i hate it even though i know the real me loves my job.where is the real me? what is happening? i hate this person i have become</e2>.i need a hug, lots of sleep and a workout. in that specific order. i don't feel good at all."

"does anyone else feel like they are no good at anything? like im able to do certain things at an okay level but i dont excel at anything. even when i put all of my effort into it, it just seem like im just not even close to where some others are at that same skill. i try to stay positive but <e1>after numerous times of just failing over and over again</e1> i begin to let it define me. <e2>i feel like a failure</e2>. then <e3>i have things like anxiety, and dpdr which make me feel like ill never even taste happiness again</e3>. idk what to do anymore."

<e1>i am so sick of the extra weight i've put on in the past year</e1>. i think it's because of <e2>my anxiety meds</e2>. i exercise daily and watch what i eat. but <e3>every time i get into the shower and glance into the mirror i see the extra 15 lbs packed around my hips and butt</e3> and <e4>my self-esteem comes crashing down</e4>. <e5>i don't want to go down the route of starving myself and i also need my meds at least until i get into therapy this winter</e5>.i don't know what to do. <e6>i just feel like shit</e6>.

looking back at old photos and videos <e1>i keep feeling very sad</e1> because <e2>the last two years seem empty</e2>. <e3>like there are so many memories and good experiences i could have been having</e3>. i remember years before my mental health issues in such good light but it seems like i just missed out on the years i've been struggling. im having better days now and i just know i would have had so many good times to look back on if i wasn't depressed.

"<e1>i feel so frustrated lately</e1>. <e2>i feel like no matter what i do, i feel like people are constantly judging when in reality</e2>, <e3>no one says anything bad about me<e3>. <e4>i have anxiety but urgh, this is too much for me</e4>. can someone please give me tips/advice?"

"anything. <e1>i'm failing in every aspect of my life</e1>. <e2>i'm anxious</e2> about everything, <e3>my heart is beating out of my chest</e3> constantly and <e4>i fear nothing will get better</e4>. i hate the physical anxiety feeling more than anything else.i ask how i can change when it comes to things i'm doing wrong with people close to me, i change those things, i'm still wrong. <e3>i panic. full-attack at the slightest misunderstanding</e3>. <e4>i look like a complete child</e4>. i used to be on top of the world. the best and always progressing at anything and everything i'd ever attempted. now i wish i could make it through one day - one day - without feeling like a total failure.i reach out to the wrong people. the more i try to avoid reaching out to them, the more i go for it and later regret it. the only people i have to talk to are the ones i've hurt/who've hurt me the most. i have no one.it's the weird feeling somewhere between i don't want to live and i don't want to die. i'm not suicidal; i just wish i could kill this part of myself."

"i start grad school tomorrow and im an anxious wreck. when <e1>im this anxious</e1>, <e2>i startle so easily</e2>. my boyfriend was sitting near the bathroom and seeing him when i walked out startled the shit out of me. my body is on constant high alert and i hate it so much. i hate taking my benzos... but today might be a xanax and chill day ?"

"i don't know why. disappointed with everything. anxious about everything. work goals are constantly changing every day. racing thoughts at home.trying to take breathing breaks but they're not as helpful as before.i don't have much details, all i have is this feeling. just want to rant.may peace find you all."

"<e1>i find it interesting and pretty sad</e1> that <e2>there are so many of us dealing with many forms of anxiety and depression</e2>. what does that tells us about the entire system that que are trapped in? i don't know what about you people, but for me it gets harder and harder to keep on holding on to the small things that i feel like could save me from getting a major depression or something bad."

"<e1>feels strange</e1>. <e2>i don't feel sad or upset, not scared or worried</e2>. <e3>worked from home so no stupid office, went out in the cold and walked around shops, went to therapy, treated myself to mcdonald's, walked back, talked to my parents, did some meditation and just feel good</e3>.not sure which one was the best but <e4>just feel okay</e4>.also not sure if i feel acceptance of my recent breakup, just feel calm.sorry if these seems like bragging but after all i've been through, this is wonderful."

"i take medication for my depression and it seems to help most of the time. im also going to be starting therapy again. anyway, i feel as if when <e1>i get my period</e1> <e2>i feel so much more depressed</e2> and cant do anything to the point where <e3>i start to be suicidal</e3>. <e4>i also get bad dreams</e4>. i just want to know if anyone else experiences it and how they deal with it."

"and frankly <e1>i'm beyond exhausted</e1> <e2>trying to keep up with everyone</e2>. i've never been able to hold a regular job like most people, and now i suddenly feel like my only shot at being happy is based upon getting a job (and making money again). <e3>""normal"" jobs</e3> usually have <e4>me crying at my desk within a few months</e4>. holding on is so very hard again when i can't land a job... i never know if its my expectations or theirs which make it worse. life is hard. i hate this. i just want some dang land so i can farm and homestead. so infuriating when people say ""you can get nice land for like $200k with a little house!"" well, kinda hard to do that when you can't make money without completely breaking down. feels like it's just a broken loop that i can't break alone. .! i don't know how to get through this. sorry for the complaining..."

"<e1>i wanna adopt a cat</e1> because <e2>i lost my cat of 10 years</e2> and <e3>i miss her</e3> and <e4>cats are awesome</e4> and <e5>i'm miserable and lonely and want someone to love and live for and for that someone to love me back</e5>, but i'm scared it wouldn't like me/need me/love me/depend on me/cuddle with me/let me pet it/love my mom more and then i'd die of heartbreak and loneliness."

"my <e1>anxiety</e1> was so right all those years ago that <e2>no one really wants me</e2>. i am safe in room its my safe space, my bubble wrap and safety blanket  and where i feel calm n safe i wish i had listened to  it all those years ago rather than fight my mind"

"<e1>i'm having a bad relapse</e1>. can't decide on what to do in life. trying to figure out what is the right thing but <e2>scared</e2>. <e3>lost</e3>. <e4>trying to take each day as it comes but struggling to breathe</e4>, <e5>feel caught under the waves</e5>. <e6>heart is hurting</e6> from <e7>my breakup</e7>. i can't stop biting my lips. <e8>bored and fed up</e8>. headaches all the time. back pain.<e9>i'm just so tired</e9>."

"<e1>i was all okay kinda bored</e1> <e2>pretended to enjoy a party with strangers a day ago</e2>, dancing and having fun but <e3>today i'm all sad and overthinking every small bit of it</e3>. <e4>feeling sick about it</e4>. judging myself more than anyone. how do i get over myself, i feel like i'm so naive and too sweet and probably everybody either pities or hates me."

"damn <e1>im so thankful and so sorry</e1> that <e2>this subreddit exists</e2>...  ive been really reeaaallly low lately, guys.... <e3>i dont have medical so i cant see a therapist or anything</e3> and <e4>ive been fucking up</e4>. bad. i didnt go to work yesterday. i didnt even call in. i just didnt show up. ive quit jobs due to <e5>depression and severe anxiety</e5> bc im a little bitch. im pretty sure ive been hitting myself when i drink bc i woke up with bruises and <e6>im always terrified no matter what</e6>. <e7>ill be sitting down chillin and all of a sudden i have to cry</e7> because <e8>im so fucking terrified</e8> like im about to face god and hes gonna send me imo hell. <e9>its so bad i do not sleep</e9>. ive woken up at 2 am every night for the last year i dont know why. i toss and turn and i cant get to or stay asleep. <e10>im so afraid all the time and im so tired all the time</e10>. depression and anxiety made me their little bitch."

"i have been dealing with depression and anxiety for several years, but not until recently, thanks to my boyfriends observations did i realise my anxiety can manifest its self in childish ways. for example, <e1>i threw a big hissy fit</e1> when <e2>my boyfriend brought home the wrong flavor of icecream</e2>, or <e3>if someone wants me to participate in something</e3> <e4>i get the urge to just stomp my feet and yell ""you can't make me!"" and ""no, i don't want to!"" like a toddler</e4>. im just curious if anyone else ever has these ""tantrums""."

"<e1>i'm so fucking tired</e1> of <e2>pretending to be okay for everyone</e2>. no one truly cares about me anyways, it's all empty questions they ask to make themselves feel better. ""how are you doing?"" oh fine, definitely not suicidal every waking moment. not like anyone would give me the time of day anyways. i'm killing myself when i get home."

hi. first time poster here:i wanted to see if anyone had some strategies to help not get overwhelmed by self-care activities. i know that a lot of my issues stem from being over extended (full time job/caregiver/just life). often times <e1>i struggle adopting active self-care activities</e1> because <e2>it just feels like one more thing hanging over my head on my to-do list</e2>. i've maintained an exercise routine for sometime (about a year constantly) and i never have felt like it has helped my stress levels. if anything i get all worked up before i go, i have not been able to start and journal/meditation practice because it just all seems like one.more.damn.thing.does anyone have anything they have tried that has helped them reframe their thinking or just generally help with this struggle?

"i watched about 3 episodes of the handmaids tail while getting my hair done, the whole time i felt sick to my stomach but i was intrigued by the plot. a few hours later im hanging out with my boyfriend and hes talking about a mindfulness conference he went to and i start crying and feeling absolutely fearful of having to live with constant unknowns. it just started up and took a while to stop. when watching the show <e1>i had a bad feeling</e1> but i just thought its cause its a thriller but then after i stopped watching that feeling kept going and got worse. it wasnt the content of the show that bothered me but just the <e2>undertones</e2>. <e3>the constant looks of fear, the lighting, the fact that none of the people look real</e3>, it got me. and again im not one to be bothered by fictional stories but this just opened up a can of worms, i think i was already on edge(i had a week that was a little tasking and a busy day) but damn even writing this now i feel queasy"

"ive been sitting at home all day doing absolutely nothing. <e1>if i was still with my boyfriend, id be with him and his family right now but nope</e1>. fucked that one up. my family doesnt do anything for easter, but <e2>my mom and her boyfriend left and now im home alone</e2>. <e3>i havent spoken to anyone today, a friend of mine was supposed to let me know if we could hang out this weekend and she never got back to me</e3>. <e4>no one has reached out to me to tell me happy easter or anything</e4>. <e5>im sitting at home right now nearly crying</e5> because <e6>im so god damn lonely<e6> and <e7>i feel like no cares about me or would care if i were to disappear</e7>...."

has anyone ever experienced long term <e1>fatigue</e1> when it comes to <e2>anxiety</e2>? i feel like <e3>its making me more anxious</e3> feeling this way. its severe to the point where i feel like falling asleep just walking anywhere. some advice on how to combat this issue would be nice.

when i see other people doing amazing new projects and being successful on facebook or just doing really well at their jobs that they had for years i know i'm supposed to feel happy for them but instead <e1>i just compare myself to them</e2> and <e2>i feel pathetic and like i'm going nowhere</e2>. <e3>i feel really sad about myself<e3> and i wish that i was doing better at age 30 and i wish i was doing some amazing projects with people and with myself instead of just struggling with money all the time.<e4>i'm not doing or being part of anything really interesting</e4>. <e5>i don't feel successful in any part of my life</e5>.i wish i had a lot going for me and money and stability and projects and i wish i didn't have depression and i didn't have to go to therapy at all.i feel like if i didnt have depression and i could somehow just be strong then i could be awesome like all these other people. <e6>i feel like a failure in life</e6> i wish i could be somebody else sometimes. <e7>sometimes i dont like myself</e7>.

"i just wanted to say if you feel like you don't remember anything anymore, there's only darkness.  can't remember you're past. maybe only ""know"" it. maybe you feel it fading away.if you don't recognize your family, if they look like strangers. like a shell. like the world is slowly disappearing and is being darkness. if you can't feel anymore. no emotions.i just wanted to say that you're not alone.when i first, i don't even remember. but it was bad. i was all alone and, i just want you to know that it's real. and it's ok to be scared and confused by it, you're not going mad, and it is real.it took for me a long time to find any evidence or anyone that might have the same symptoms as i suffer from. and i went to doctors and neurologists and psychiatrists, and i couldn't explain what's going on, and no one believed me. i want to share this with as many people as i can. i don't want you to suffer in anonymity and ignorance as i have. i'm gonna try and post it in as many relevent subreddits as i can.that's all i wanted to say. thnx."

im debating buying a weighted blanket and im curious if anyone has any experience using/purchasing weighted blankets? ive seen some people say they work and some say they dont? im also curious if they are easy fo clean since i have two dogs?any feedback is appreciated!

"hi, guys i'm really freaking out. <e1>it's my first job</e1> and <e2>i got way too excited</e2> when <e3>i got my work orientation email</e3>. i didn't realize it until after. i read through everything but for some reason my brain decided to ignore the words ""do not acess worday (the hr website) until orientation day"" anyways i logged in and submitted something that apparently was i supposed to submit it when i got to orientation. i'm really scared guys do you think i'd be penalized or possibly not get the job anymore because i started the onboarding process before orientation? help :( i'm such an idiot."

"can an individual have a panic attack and genuinely not know theyre having it? not lack of recognition but genuinely not know? no obvious symptoms that arent there constantly anyway.can anxiety/panic attacks  cause wide spread, constant severe pain? not heart attack in the moment pain, but 24/7 debilitating joint, muscle and bone pain?can panic attacks last full days (in order to cause widespread severe pain)if yes to all the above, how does one deal with unrecognizable panic and anxiety without knowing the cause, feeling anxious or worried, or panicked?many thanks."

"<e1>i often get nausea or sour stomach feeling</e1> when <e2>i feel super anxious and stressed</e2>, i handle it fine but i try to not let it affect my work too much. there have been times where i have to vomit or dry heave in the middle of a workday and i'll return to my desk despite how shitty i feel. when i feel really bad, i'll go home early but <e3>i feel guilty</e3> when i feel sick sometimes. <e4>like i have a full time job and shouldn't complain about anything but there will be days where i feel like i'm fighting my body just to get through the day</e4>. anyone else have similar experiences?"

"it's been 4 weeks that i'm stuck with severe anxiety. i have major chest pain all the way through my back. it last all day and night. i cant sleep. i can't tolerate any noise or people. my medication doesn't seems to help. i've been battling depression, on and off, for 32 years and anxiety all my life. has years goes by, i realize that i will never be the same. <e1>the meds</e1> makes me <e2>numb</e2>, everything is just ""ok"", nothing more nothing less. <e3>i wish i could hope for better days</e3> <e4>but depression / anxiety are creeping up on me at any time</e4>, it's a never endind story. and of course i need to show a happy face and preform at work as if i wasn't suffering. and i hear people say: ""it will get better, you'll see"" . i'm still waiting for those better days. no wonder why people in that situation lose hope. i just wish for a real cure before i die...from old age."

"when i'm in the ""getting a job is easy"" mindset, i find it easy to get a job, but lately i've had less energy to look for jobs. i'm graduating soon, but a lot of jobs i looked at was either not even close to my career trajectory or was at a shitty company. <e1>i'm getting overwhelmed</e1> because <e2>i don't know what to apply to anymore</e2> because <e3>i'm trying to think if they're right for me</e3>, but i also want to leave my current job (although now i'm thinking i should work 2 jobs)."

"hey, first time ive ever posted. just feel the need to vent.<e1>ive been diagnosed with depression and general anxiety disorder</e1>. im on mirtazapine 30mg due to <e2>not being able to sleep</e2>.i have been off work for 2 months. my problem is. i over think. i seem to live inside my head and thoughts. i go to bed and my mind runs wild. its like a kaleidoscope of worry. <e3>i cant actually pick out what i worry about as i go from one worry to the next</e3> so quickly that <e4>i cant process it all</e4>.ive never felt suicidal but recently i have been feeling so down that thoughts of ending my life have crept up.im married and have been for 6 years and <e5>would never take my life</e5> as <e6>i wouldnt put that onto my wife or my family</e6>.i just dont know how to stop these feelings."

lately i've been getting these anxiety attacks when doing the most mundane things that i had even a remotely emotional connection to. basic things like playing video games or reading books and watching certain shows that i used to do with my ex or with my friends just put me in a really depressive state and i don't really know how to deal with this. i just want to be able to enjoy a round of a video game i like without ending up wanting to die by the end. <e1>i don't really understand what to do anymore</e1> since <e2>anything i used to enjoy just makes me feel like hell</e2> so i sit around doing nothing but that leaves me alone with my thoughts and that's even worse.

"so i am sitting here on my couch my head is aching, my neck is tight, my jaw is tense and my stomach is upset. <e1>my anxiety</e1> isn't always just <e2>stress, worry, fear, playing in my head on fast forward and repeat</e2>. sometimes it causes <e3>severe panic attacks, sometimes it makes me physically ill, other times i am just frozen in place overwhelmed by things that need done but not knowing where to start</e3>. i eventually end up doing one thing, while starting another thing,  and so on. then none of the things get completed. things have become so bad, so scary, so stressful that i can't leave my house. i force myself through tears and panic attacks to go to my medical appointments...but that is all i can manage. i have been this way for 9 months. tomorrow i am to travel an hour away to go to 2 medical exams scheduled for ssd. i have been waiting 8 months to get an answer from them, so i know i have to go. i am so nervous and filled with dread! that it is making me sick. any suggestions? anyone been through the disability exams?"

"i am a very emotional person and often i absorb others emotions as well. i want people to able to share with me and i am often a shoulder to cry on, and i am happy to be that person. lately the people in my life have been going through many things. ive been trying to be there for everyone but i have also been going through my own anxiety and depression. (im in my second semester of college and have been feeling very overwhelmed lately) <e1>ive just been feeling like i dont have anyone that i can talk to</e1>. <e2>i dont want to burden my family and friends who are going through their own traumas</e2> but im starting to feel myself spiral again. as well as that i know im taking on the feelings of everyone i try to help and i want to be there for them but i can feel the weight building everyday. i dont know what to do."

"i dont care about the presents, or the money, or even the food. i just wish i could feel like a normal happy person, have friend and enjoy life. not suffer through this boring life filled with paranoia, insecurity, depression and sleepless nights. i just wish it all could be over for once or that i could at least get a hug to ease the pain."

"i had a really good day today. everything felt great, i was happy... but that feels wrong. how can i be depressed if im happy? i know that you can be happy sometimes, but i just feel like im faking being depressed whenever im happy.this shit just keeps cycling through my mind over and over again. now im on the brink of another anxiety attack and <e1>im getting super depressed again</e1> and <e2>everything feels like shit</e2>, how do i not blame myself for this?i hate this feeling. <e3>i dont want to tell my family</e3> because <e4>they never just let me vent, and i cant seem to explain to them</e4> that <e5>i dont want to go to another goddamn therapist</e5> because <e6>that hasnt worked</e6>. <e7>i dont want to tell my friends</e7> because <e8>they already have enough shit to deal with</e8>.every night i wonder why i cant just be normal and not worry about every fucking thing and just be glad i was happy for a day."

"sometimes i honestly wish that i had selective amnesia. nostalgia ruins me. i feel like my mind constantly drifts to the way things used to be, things that i wish i could be the same again, be it relationships or experiences. and i literally feel a ton of weight pressing down on my chest, filling me with dread. i know my mind deceives me and things were never as perfect as i make them out to be, but wow memories of the past hit me hard. seeking help turning my mind into a white noise machine rather than something that drives me insane every night thanks!!!"
